Other instances of stupidity, which I observed in their comrades' method of handling their armS, Ihave neither time nor inclination to commemorate. 131001(- heads of this kind were sent us by the captains for the defence of the colonies, whilst the more skilful, the more active, those in short that alone deserved the name of Spaniards, were left at home to increase their property.

On the same day which was rendered so memorable by the assault of the TobaS, when we thought ourselves out of danger, ten savage horsemen, issuing from 3 neighbouring wood about sun-set, presented themselves to our sight, but quickly disappeared. The general opinion was that they were spies, and this gave us occasion to suspect that the enemies were lurking disguised in ambush, in the intent of returning at night to surprize us.
